mosinstall.name: Multiple Random Images Module
mosinstall.author: Craig Graham
mosinstall.description:
// Multiple Random Images Module v1.0 //

This module displays multiple random images from a directory of your choice. Set the folder, number of images to display, and orientation (horizontal or verticle) - and you are ready to go.

This software does not come with a warranty, guarantee or support. It works just fine with my server configuration. Use at your own risk.

Best Practices:

  • Images File Names - use lowercase with no spaces -for example walk_in_park_01.jpg
  • Image Sizes - it is best to upload images already sized to your dimensions for faster load times
  • Styles - for custom styling, use the CSS class names and create custom styles in css template

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (moduletable), this allows individual module styling.

param.name: count
param.label: Number of Images to Display
param.description: Enter the number of unique random images you wish to display. DO NOT enter a number that is larger than the number of images in folder.

param.name: exts
param.label: Type of images to display
param.description: Enter the image file type extensions here - For example - jpg,jpeg,png,gif - comma seperated no spaces

param.name: orientation
param.label: Orientation
param.description: Select the orientation of the images. If you only want 1 image, this does not matter.

param.name: div_class
param.label: DIV Class name
param.description: Enter a class name for custom CSS styling purposes

param.name: img_class
param.label: IMG Class name
param.description: Enter a class name for custom CSS styling purposes

param.name: img_margin
param.label: Image Margin
param.description: Enter an integer and px or em to create margins between images - for example - 5px - leave blank if using CSS

param.name: img_width
param.label: Image Width (px)
param.description: To force your image to a specific width (verticle orientation), enter it here. To use the default width, leave this field blank.

param.name: img_height
param.label: Image Height (px)
param.description: To force your image to a specific height (horizontal orientation), enter it here. To use the default height, leave this field blank.
